comments:
I'm trying to get something similar to chapter 2.5.4 of the EMF Book (Dynamic
EMF, page 35).
I have a generated EPackage with *abstract* classes that shall serve as super
classes for
a number of other (non-generated) classes. These other classes are reflectively
composed
at runtime. They all inherit one of the abstract classes of the generated EPackage.

When I use the EFactory of the dynamic EPackage to create an EObject, it tries
to locate
the lowest super class that is generated. But unfortunately all the generated
super types
in my generated EPackage are abstract! The create() method of the factory throws a:


java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The class 'ItSystem' is not a valid classifier
    at
com.sympedia.mde.product.impl.ProductFactoryImpl.create(ProductFactoryImpl.java:45)
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EFactoryImpl.create(EFactoryImpl.java:207)
    at com.sympedia.mde.internal.SystemNature.createItSystem(SystemNature.java:537)
    [...] 

Ed answered in the newsgroup:
=============================
You can't create a dynamic derived instance of a generated abstract class
because no factory will be able to create the generated abstract instance.  So
your workaround (don't make the generated base classes abstract) is the only way
to make it work.

I think this is a permanent limitation.  I can't think of how to fix it.  I'll
think some more and give you time to suggest something...

Eike, 

I can't see any way around this limitation.  If the generated Impl is abstract,
we can't instantiate it unless we generate a derived class that isn't abstract,
and because we are trying to support dynamic, that's not an option either.

Ed,

I don't know any way either ;-(
So let's stay with non-abstract base classes...

traces.message: The class 'ItSystem' is not a valid classifier
